name: Exposed Lies v2.2
description:
Another new version...again. I'm really spending the time testing and tweaking this thing, so there's a lot.

Firstly, I took the Sneakdoors out after one game once I realized I would have to add some extra MUs in to be able to use it and almost anything else. The Garrotes weren't helping this cause either. And I was never using the Garrotes because of their high cost. On top of that, I could never have a full rig (including Snitch) with Garrote, so I cut it for 3 Ninjas, which keeps in it faction. 3 Aliases might be the better choice, but we'll see.

Other than that, I added in another Easy Mark. That's it.

name: Whizzard - Anarchs will rise
description: Account Siphon Whizzard. The problem is getting into HQ to pull off the AS which leads us to Deep Red and Overmind to put pressure on the corp, because suddenly nowhere is safe, thereafter. I noticed that over the long game, I start running out of power counters on Overmind and usually Knights dont stick around to long, so I added e3 Feedback Implants to keep those around for longer. It also lets me muscle through massive Glacier HB decks which are super expensive. Also added a Djinn/Virus package. Its a little slow and clunky but between Account Siphoning you definitely are slowing the corp down. I also love this deck because depending on your draws, you can attack from many different angles: Account Siphon + Rook for economy and ICE, Parasites + Data Suckers to destroy the expensive/big ICE, Medium for R&D multi-access, Hemorrhage for HQ pressure and DLR for R&D and Archives.

name: HB Glacier
description: Glacier is my favorite archetype. Lots of large taxing ICE and all the Sentries have teeth that the runner needs to deal with. Adonis and Eves are the main money engines with Melange in the scoring server. Ash is there for the extra protection when you need it most. Nice balance between operation economy and asset economy and EtF is the rock that holds it together.

name: Tag 'em & Bag 'em.
description: Influence: Weyland

name: Top 12 Louisville: Stirling, Cooper, Draper, Price v3
description:
• v1.5: -3 Siphon, +3 Calling In Favors.
  • v2: -3 Calling in Favors, +3 Siphon, -1 ProCo, +1 DONUT!
  • v3: -6 centrals-only breakers, -2 Crash Space, -2 Daily Casts, +3 NACH, +1 Logos, +3 Express Delivery, +2 Crypsis, +2 Femme. 13th seed in swiss, top-12 finish at 69-player Louisville Regional.

I swapped out my centrals-only breaker approach for @theryanburke 's Crypsis+Femme package. I never, ever played Femme, but I think I want at least one as a backup option.

I'm still on the learning curve with the deck, but Iain did some serious work against a strong field where I didn't get to play any of the decks I know I can wreck, viz. CI and Weyland. Lost two games due to lack of skill (got too aggressive too soon against RP, still shaky on HBETF), and one game because I had poor draws against a TWIY player that had the Astrotrain.

I feel like Donut is so harsh for Ops Weyland / CI that I want to leave him in there (for the lulz), but I also lost a game because I couldn't dig fast enough, and Ryan's build uses that influence on +1 Motivation, +1 Quality Time, and that's tempting.

You don't need 3 NACH. 2 would be fine. Data Dealer is probably fine to drop unless you expect Jinteki in numbers (Shu-Kyu, Medical Breakthrough), since as it turns out the only reason to sell agendas in this deck is for the lulz.

But then I go back to being unsure about how to beat CI with just one Legwork, so I'm leaning towards -1 NACH, +1 Legwork. My Kingdom for a Motivation tutor.

Open questions:

  1. HBFA / CI: What's the best approach to these nuts? The Source put in major, major work vs. NBN; but it is at most a thorn to a Redcoats or ToL based FA build (because NBN ice is... not happy against crypsis + 15+c), whereas HB can build some supremely dickish remotes.
  2. Should I just give up on my dreams of playing Donut against a Weyland or CI player at a tourney and join Ryan in playing a third motivation?
  3. Them Femmes: is there a better option?
  4. Will Weyland players on OCTGN ever learn to not give me bad pub? How much blackmail is too much blackmail?

name: Top 12 Louisville: If it Bleeds, it Leads v3
description:
And hopefully, it will bleed a lot.

So, I like to include a 1-of ICE in all my tourney decks that nobody expects. In this case, it is Snoop. I actually got to use it in a couple matches, and there's nothing better than disorienting a runner ;).

I also have a preference for decks with multiple outs. This deck can FA (SanSan + Astro); it can SE; and it can PsychoBeale. Fear of the latter two opens up FA wins once runners see either; if runners see SE, you can often still psycho, if they see psycho, you can often still SE.

This deck was a champ in the Swiss rounds. I psycho'd out one game, SE'd another, lost one to me being a complete dunce, and FA'd the rest, including two of my new favorite "I can't believe this play is legal" scoring-the-game-winning-agenda-from-deck wins with Fast Track. Seriously. Fast Track. We need to have a national conversation about Fast Track Violence or somethin ;).

It completely fell apart in elims, being both of my losses: the first to a business-as-usual Andy deck that trolled me hard, the second I should have won: had 15 tags on the runner, snoop tokens, an SE and a Beale in hand + money, but two turns of power draws (for Psycho or SE) produced only agendas. Variance is a MFer ;).

Oh, and it actually doesn't bleed much: 75% or more of the wins will be "normal NBN shenanigans", which now includes getting to 5+ a token and a SanSan and Fast Tracking the win from the R&D for a dollar (FT, install, advance + token).

name: Noise core set, WLA, CE
Test
description: Rough draft, trying kenma for the extra influence

name: Custom Graphics
description:
Basically the point of this deck is hitting a midseason to psycho out your big agendas or Ares. A psycho'd Ares can effectively spell the end for the Runner. Now that Domestic Sleepers is a thing, it presents the Runner with a Dilemma: do I let the Corp easily score out their Domestic Sleepers, or do I leave myself vulnerable for midseason? Otherwise, the rest of the deck is about gaining as much econ as possible. Shout out to NEXT ICE for making an appearance: now that's there are 6 available, they serve as both cheap early ETRs and late-game taxing ICE. I like it.

Edit Updated list here: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/6559/custom-graphics-v1-1

name: Gabe  core set, WLA, CE
The scent of success...
description: Hitting centrals hard and often. Plenty of event based economy, with Kati for long hauls and Decoy to try and keep her alive a bit longer. 4 turns fuelling Kati will pay for Blackguard straight up.

name: Making News Core Set, WLA, CE
Personal Evolution Core Set, WLA, CE
Asset News
Bullet to the Face
description: Recently edited my deck. I am still rather new but I am learning. This is a hybrid deck built to either kill (tag and bag) or score (big ice). Its built around transaction Weyland and I have thoroughly enjoyed it. I used to only have 1 copy of jackson in the deck and kept getting criticized about not have 3. So I kinda got tired of it and have been in a "screw it" mood and I took him out in place of the junebug. I love the refinery and put it in in place of the single mining corp i had. I want to test out the efficiency of it. overall this deck has moderately high success. I only have lost against multiple account siphon runs which I havent been able to counter. They drain me of money and I cant keep up in the long run. any advice would be welcome

name: Pressure Test (Trial 4)
Leak of Data
description:
by:螺旋的风筝 http://tieba.baidu.com/p/3086198124

Core card：Joshua B.; Data Leak Reversal; John Masanori; New Angeles City Hall; Crash Space; Snitch.

Basic idea:

Begin the cycle after corp scored the first agenda, then when your turn begins, you gain 2 credits.

1st click:make an unsuccessful run(Snitch or etr), and take 1 tag(John Masanori)

2nd,3rd,4th click:use Data Leak Reversal to trash 3 card

5th click:use 2 credits (Crash Space) to remove the tag from John Masanori

At the end of the turn, use the 2 credits (ID) to avoid 1 tag (New Angeles City Hall) from Joshua B..

PS:Net Shield for Jinteki; Fall Guy for Elizabeth Mills

name: GABE.ERWIN
Spawn More Remotes
New Runner Deck
Space Hobo
Space Hobo
Planned Assault CT - Louisville Regionals top 16
description:
This deck performed pretty well, going 3-2 in swiss rounds.

A few things I'll likely change:

-1 Stimhack +1 Mimic. The tempo hit from femme is sometimes huuuge overkill when you just want to break a draco, caduceus, rototurret, etc.

-1 levy, +1 Zu: Same reasoning here. Quandry needs a cheaper answer than 9 credits.

I have considered dropping dino - could see adding in an escher and maybe one mem chip. Sure, dino can be huge efficiency, but your breakers are so expensive that if you cant test run femme in the early game, it takes a while to get up and running, even with Opus.

Besides that, solid deck

name: NBN NA Rush - Louisville Regionals top 16
description:
My standard MN deck did well, doing 4-1 in swiss.

Its a deck that can fast advance, but doesnt have to. Lost to a Kate parasite recursion, when I drew roughly half the ice that i should have on average, and lost to an Ian sterling list in elimination that was running 3 link and the source. Still performed admirably.

Changes: -1 fast track +1 Jackson: Fast track is awesome when its awesome, but can be a dead card fairly often, especially early.

-1 Archer -1 Draco +2 Eli: Some more early game taxing ice that isn't screwed on the occassional high link matchup.

name: Criminals Silhouette carillion v4.1
Space Hobo
Haas-Bioroid: Paladin
description:
The quick, dirty break down of this deck is to protect your core and create two remote super servers, once this has been established its time to show what Director Haas can do for the SanSan City Grid. Scoring 3 point agendas for only 2 credits (1 if its your first install) and 3 of your 4 clicks is hard to contend with. The only real thing I've ever had to worry about is a suicide run at Director Haas, but if you've already scored Mandatory Upgrades you're set.

This deck as gone 13/2, only being shot down when I've been unlucky enough to have my hand flooded with agendas.

The ICE I have chosen for this deck is fairly basic a surprise Rototurret for Archives, Guard for HQ and RnD, Enigma for the head of your remote servers and the rest to fill in where needed. I added in Precognition to help with Accelerated Beta Test and Archived Memories to aid in any mishaps you may come across while you smite evil.

This is the first deck I have submitted to netrunnerdb.com and I hope you all enjoy. Let me know if I've missed some glaring weakness that my friends didn't notice and exploit. Thank you.

name: Off the Grid (Top 16 San Antonio regionals)
description:
Weird deck I brought to San Antonio regionals, with ~48 attending. I was surprised this deck did so well, pulling 50% win rate with three very close losses. This deck needs to flex play with what is draws every game, but the goal is simple. Create huge taxing walls and score behind huge costly runs the runner will eventually make. Or pulling off the Curtain Wall + whatever over HQ wombo combo, with Caprice at the root and Off the Grid at a remote with preferably an Archer or Hadrians over there too.

They will play around Scorch, which you do not run, slowing their play further. Inazuma is for Archer combos, and creating a huge tax wall. I would personally substitute one Inazuma for an Aggressive Secretary after playing 20+ live games with this deck, but this is what I brought. Power Shutdown their Corroders/Fairies if you ever get the chance.

name: Macgyver 2.6
description:
Possible: -1 Deus Ex/Sharpshooter +2 Plascrete for Scorched protection.

Otherwise, usually running around 4-6 link to help with traces and the money generation helps with dropping tags. Only a couple games in with this one, and the only trouble I have is getting the Pro Contacts out fast enough. Still room for another Hostage splash, but not sure what to drop.

Prepaid is a bit wasteful when a lot of my events are 0 cost, but playing Sure Gamble to gain 7 always makes me feel good and the corp grimace. Free Makers and Legworks are nice and then I Levy AR to get them all back and play them again. And free Test Runs to find my breakers, and then Scavenge them out or just draw them next turn and Mod them out.

name: NeoTokyo GRNDL Trick of Light Commeralization
description: Non-interactive with the runner, just straight forward advancing ICE and building a strong economy.

name: Weyland GRNDL carillion v3.0
Pro Grim
description: So, basically this deck is meant to focus simply on icebreakers (finding, installing, pumping up, etc.). With earlier versions of this deck (much more program heavy), I found that I was able to get the icebreakers I needed installed earlier in the game but then spent the majority of my clicks searching for events or resources that just weren't coming up. Really, I would audibly groan when yet another effing Crypsis would show his ugly cyborg face. So, I cut down on the actual program size and put in junk like Diesel and Professional Contacts to make it more efficient. Hopefully.

name: Weyland: Building a flatter world
description:
Relatively simple standard Weyland deck for scorching the runner into the next century. Grndl refinery provides solid econ, backed with the transaction events, whilst the low levels of ice stack to form a scoring server. Can either score by sea-scorching the runner, or standard advancing agendas. Will suffer against mill decks, central only breaker decks, and heavy dig decks.

Any thoughts as always much appreciated.

name: Custom Graphics v1.1
description:
Basically the point of this deck is hitting a midseason to psycho out your big agendas or Ares. A psycho'd Ares can effectively spell the end for the Runner. Now that Domestic Sleepers is a thing, it presents the Runner with a Dilemma: do I let the Corp easily score out their Domestic Sleepers, or do I leave myself vulnerable for midseason? Otherwise, the rest of the deck is about gaining as much econ as possible. Shout out to NEXT ICE for making an appearance: now that's there are 6 available, they serve as both cheap early ETRs and late-game taxing ICE. I like it.

Edit Changes: -1 Project Ares, +1 Project Vitruvius. -2 Psychographics, +1 Scorched Earth, +1 Sweeps Week. While Ares' effect is very nice, Vitruvius can setup easy recurrences of either Psychographics or Scorched, leading to a quick end-game. Filled the final spot with 1 more Sweeps Week, so I'm either gaining econ, playing ICE, or hanging onto combo pieces (with Jackson there to occasionally bail me out of bad situations). After a bit of playtesting, I've also done -1 Ichi 1.0 for +1 Mother Goddess. Goddess is a much better sight in my opening hand than Ichi, and she beefs up my NEXT ICE.

name: Moocher V.1
description: Get your efficient breakers on Personal Workshop and then run use the credits from the rezzed ice to pay off your programs. Sharpshooter and Deus X keep you safe from anything too nasty and the SC keep your rig up through power shutdown or trashing effects. Once you have the suite out plus a Toolbox or a Cyberfeeder you can break anything the corp rezzes for the price they pay to rezz it. All the other cards can be played for 4 credits or less credits. Click Kati to fund your end game runs. Thoughts and suggestions are much appreciated.

name: SHAPER DECK
Moocher v.2
description: Get your efficient breakers on Personal Workshop and then run use the credits from the rezzed ice to pay off your programs. Sharpshooter and Deus X keep you safe from anything too nasty and the SC keep your rig up through power shutdown or trashing effects. Once you have the suite out plus a Toolbox or a Cyberfeeder you can break anything the corp rezzes for the price they pay to rezz it. All the other cards can be played for 4 credits or less credits. Click Kati to fund your end game runs. Thoughts and suggestions are much appreciated.

name: PrePaid Rein-a-Destruction
description:
Kind of liking how this Reina deck worked out in the test games. It's surprisingly effective to have a -2 cost Lucky Find, and Retrieval Runs (for very cheap I might add) allow for recurring lost breakers and parasites. Not sure about Dirty Laundry, might add more mediums and nerves instead. I need to playtest more to see if the economy is too much/too little.

The draw power could definitely use some fine tuning, and I need a cheaper Killer, big time.

name: Flytrap 1.2
description: I will win without SanSans or Astros.

name: Midseason regionals
rp glacier
NEXT Level v2.0.5
description:
The latest iteration of my NEXT Design deck. The changes between this version and my NEXT Level 2.0 are indicative of the "tour circuit" I took this deck to (3 Store Champs, Chronos stop and OCTGN BGG Tourney 3[EU]), and reflects the changes to the card pool over that time.

The combination of Asset and Operation economy ensures that I should not be able to have my econ completely destroyed by my opponent (barring extreme Anarch shenanigans). I've got a long way to go before I can be convinced to leave Sweeps Week behind :-)

The ICE composition looks a bit schizophrenic, however thus far it has served me quite well. The Destroyers help reset the board state, turning my gear-checks back on in the mid-late game. Vipers are beautiful to see opening hand/early for HQ protection, particularly if I don't have an Agenda in my initial 5 cards.

Agenda spread is to help the econ situation out as well; Virtuvius are there to be overscored if possible to pull back problematic ABTs. Pet Project can also help here, although it is primarily Archer fodder and/or the 4th Adonis.

The deck is likely to see a large overhaul with the release of Upstalk, as the desire to get 3 NEXT Silvers and at least 2 Mother Goddess' (to provide a 7th possible NEXT ICE), as well as a re-examination of some other compositions will cause some disruption.

name: Moocher v.6
description: Get your efficient breakers on Personal Workshop and then run and use the credits from the rezzed ice or a well timed Stim Hack to get your breaker suite out. Once out it will break any ice that is unrezzed with your ID credits and the help of Toolbox and Cyberfeeder. An early RnD Interface can do work too if you run with no credits. Some corps wont rez to give you credits to pay the PW so you just get 2 cards. This deck is very "techy" so plan a turn or two in advance so that you are maximizing Nasir's ID.

name: Infection
description:
This deck is to apply earlier pressure with Darwin and defeat cheap ice. Parasite knock down anything bigger. Professional Contacts keep me drawing Cyberfeeder subsidized viruses and economy events. Surge prevents me from being locked down after wiping viruses and Same Old Thing keeps Surge and Déjà Vu available.

As always any comments would be appreciated.
